lead_paragraph: The Pan American Games got off to a sputtering start yesterday in Rio de Janeiro with baseball postponements and reports of a delay in televising gymnastics, one of the premier sports at the event.Organizers postponed two baseball games — the United States vs. the Dominican Republic, and Brazil against Nicaragua — after a power outage at the new stadium.It was not the way the Brazilians wanted to begin the biggest sporting event they have ever staged, particularly since they are seeking to put on the 2014 World Cup and 2016 Summer Olympics.ESPN Brazil reported problems at another new site, the Rio Multisport Arena, that led to the delay of coverage of the men’s team gymnastics competition. The opening ceremony was accompanied by a few problems Friday night at the famed Maracanã stadium, but it was a spectacular show. Security was so strict that many fans could not get to the newly renovated stadium in time.
